description:
Configuration for a disk image license agreement. This is an array of objects, one for each localization of the license agreement.

Disk image license agreements can be multilingual. A disk image can contain several license agreements, and macOS will show the one appropriate for the user's preferred language.

charset.description:
A character set name, as understood by the Node.js iconv module [1]. Case insensitive.

The special value "native" means the text is already in the appropriate classic Mac OS character set, and no character set conversion should be done.

[1] https://github.com/bnoordhuis/node-iconv

encoding.description: A binary encoding type. Only base64 is supported.

languageCode.description:
A classic Mac OS language code, as it appears in `Script.h` of `CarbonCore.framework` [1].

[1] https://github.com/phracker/MacOSX-SDKs/blob/master/MacOSX10.6.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/CoreServices.framework/Versions/A/Frameworks/CarbonCore.framework/Versions/A/Headers/Script.h

items.description: One localization of a license agreement.

type.description:
Which format the text is in: either plain text or RTF.

Default is "plain", except when the file path ends in “.rtf”, in which case the default is "rtf".

text.description:
Text of the license agreement, specified directly in JSON.

Besides literal text, this can be base64 encoded. If it is, also specify "encoding": "base64", and give the character set in the "charset" property.

charset.description:
Character set of the "text" property, if it is encoded.

If this property is specified, the "encoding" property must also be specified.

encoding.description:
Encoding of the "text" property, if it is encoded.

If this property is specified, the "charset" property must also be specified.

file.description: Path to the file containing the license text.

charset.description: Character set used in the file.

encoding.description: Special encoding of the file, if any.

labels.description:
Localized labels for the buttons on the license agreement window. There are six: "languageName" (optional), "agree", "disagree", "print", "save", and "message". They may be given in the JSON configuration file, or from separate file(s).

Some languages have a default set of labels that will be used if none are provided here, but for all other languages, a set of labels must be provided. Default label sets are available for en-US, fr-FR, en-GB, de-DE, it-IT, nl-NL, sv-SE, es-ES, da-DK, fr-CA, nb-NO, ja-JP, fi-FI, ko-KR, zh-CN, zh-TW, zh-Hans, zh-Hant, and pt-BR.

charset.description:
Character set of the label strings or file(s). The exact meaning of this property depends on the "type" property:

• When "type" is not "raw" and "charset" is absent, label strings are UTF-8.

• When "type" is absent, "inline", or "json", the "charset" property indicates that the label strings are encoded, and what their actual character set is. In this case, the "encoding" property must also be specified.

• When "type" is "one-per-file" or "delimited", the "charset" property indicates the character set of the label file(s). The default character set is UTF-8.

• When "type" is "raw", the "charset" property must be absent.

encoding.description:
Encoding of the label strings or file(s).

If this property is specified, and "type" is absent, "inline", or "json", then the "charset" property must also be specified.

type.description:
How the label strings are structured.

• When "type" is absent or "inline", label strings are given directly, in the "languageName", "agree", "disagree", "print", "save", and "message" properties.

• When "type" is "one-per-file", the label properties ("languageName", "agree", "disagree", "print", "save", and "message") contain paths to single files, each of which contains only that label.

• When "type" is "json", there must be a "file" property containing the path to an external JSON file. It must contain an object with "languageName" (optional), "agree", "disagree", "print", "save", "message" properties. They are interpreted as though "type" were "inline".

• When "type" is "raw", there must be a "file" property containing the path to an external file containing a classic Mac OS STR# data structure, as DiskImageMounter expects. The file's contents are copied into the disk image as a STR# resource without any sort of conversion.

• When "type" is "delimited", there must be a "file" and a "delimiter" property. "file" must be the path to an external file containing five or six strings (for "languageName" (optional), "agree", "disagree", "print", "save", and "message", in that order) separated by a delimiter. The "delimiter" property indicates what sequence of bytes will serve as the delimiter.

delimiters.description:
Sequences of bytes that will be interpreted as delimiter strings.

Each item in this array may be either an array of bytes (given as numbers between 0 and 255), or one of the following shorthands:

• "tab": [9] (an ASCII tab character)
• "lf": [10] (an ASCII line feed character)
• "cr": [13] (an ASCII carriage return character)
• "crlf": [13, 10] (an ASCII CR+LF pair)
• "nul": [0] (a zero byte)
• "eol": any line ending (LF, CR, or CR+LF)

If the "encoding" property is also specified, delimiters must not be encoded. They must occur literally in the file.

Used when "type" is "delimited".

file.description:
Path to an external file containing the label strings.

Used when "type" is "one-per-file", "json", "raw", or "delimited".

languageName.description:
Human-readable name of the language that this version of the license agreement is in, such as “English” or “Français”.

Used when "type" is absent, "inline", or "one-per-file".

agree.description:
Label text for the “Agree” button.

If "type" is "one-per-file", this is instead the path to a file containing the label text.

Used when "type" is absent, "inline", or "one-per-file".

disagree.description:
Label text for the “Disagree” button.

If "type" is "one-per-file", this is instead the path to a file containing the label text.

Used when "type" is absent, "inline", or "one-per-file".

print.description:
Label text for the “Print” button.

If "type" is "one-per-file", this is instead the path to a file containing the label text.

Used when "type" is absent, "inline", or "one-per-file".

save.description:
Label text for the “Save” button.

If "type" is "one-per-file", this is instead the path to a file containing the label text.

Used when "type" is absent, "inline", or "one-per-file".

message.description:
Brief instructions for the user.

For example, the English default message is: “If you agree with the terms of this license, press "Agree" to install the software.  If you do not agree, press "Disagree".”

If "type" is "one-per-file", this is instead the path to a file containing the label text.

Used when "type" is absent, "inline", or "one-per-file".

lang.description: Which language(s) this version of the license agreement is in. Can be a language tag like "en-US", a classic Mac OS language code like 0, or an array of language tags and/or language codes.

default.description:
If set to true, marks this version of the license as the default. The default version is shown by DiskImageMounter when there is no other version of the license that better matches the user's language preferences.

If no version of the license is marked as default, the first one is used as the default.
